column1: The Yuledays were the two days of the Shire Calendar that marked the end of one year and the beginning of the next. They fell outside the formal months of the calendar
column2: coming after the month of Foreyule and being followed in turn

column1: They formed the centre of the six-day Yuletide festival (29 December to 2 January) celebrated not only in the Shire
column2: but also by other northern cultures of Middle-earth.
